newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: Lithuanian yr/yr Q2 GDP rose one pct-official.
newsitem.headline: Lithuanian yr/yr Q2 GDP rose one pct-official.

text.p: Lithuania's gross domestic product (GDP) grew one percent in current prices in the second quarter of 1996 versus the same period last year, for a 3.1 percent first-half gain, the statistics office said on Monday.
The statistics take inflation, which was at a year-on-year level of 24.3 percent in August, into account.

The office said in a statement that GDP in the second quarter of 1996 was 7.522 billion litas, versus 5.836 billion litas in the second quarter of last year. GDP in the first quarter of 1996 was 6.462 billion litas.
First-half GDP was 13.984 billion litas, a 3.1 percent gain on the first half of 1995, the office said.
